newsitem.title: USA: Tidewater to buy offshore unit for $525 mln.
newsitem.headline: Tidewater to buy offshore unit for $525 mln.

text.p: Tidewater Inc said on Thursday it agreed to acquire the O.I.L. Ltd unit of Britain's Ocean Group plc, and its related international marine operating companies, for 328 million sterling or about $525 million.

The O.I.L. companies owned and operated a fleet of about 100 vessels, principally composed of platform supply and anchor handling towing supply vessels which operated in major international offshore oil and gas exploration areas, other than the United States, the company said.
The acquisition was expected to close in late April, Tidewater said. It would be financed under a $600 million credit facility arranged by Tidewater's principal lenders.
William O'Malley, Tidewater's chairman, said the purchase would give the company a meaningful presence in the North Sea platform supply and anchor handling towing supply markets.
"Following the acquisition, Tidewater will have approximately 750 vessels operating in every major offshore oil and gas exploration area in the world," he said.
